English.Keywords: Java Compiler small fast Embedded Expression evaluation Script Scripting JVM Virtual Machine Bytecode run-time compilation JSP server pages
English.Char_Desc_80: A super-small, super-fast Java compiler that compiles expressions or scripts on-the-fly.
English.Char_Desc_250: Janino is a super-small, super-fast compiler that reads a Java expression, block, or source file, and generates Java bytecode that is loaded and executed directly. It is not intended to be a development tool, but an embedded compiler for run-time compilation purposes.
English.Char_Desc_450: Janino is a super-small, super-fast compiler that reads a Java expression, block, or source file, and generates Java bytecode that is loaded and executed directly. It is not intended to be a development tool, but an embedded compiler for run-time compilation purposes, such as expression evaluators or "server pages" engines like JSP.
English.Char_Desc_2000:
Janino is a super-small, super-fastcompiler that reads a Java expression, block, or source file, and generates Java bytecode that is loaded and executed directly. It is not intended to be a development tool, but an embedded compiler for run-time compilation purposes, such as expression evaluators or "server pages" engines like JSP.
Properties
The major design goal was to keep the compiler small and simple, while partially sacrificing completeness. I don't like the idea of carrying around huge libraries for simple applications. See Parser for the list of implemented and missing language features.
When do you need an efficient expression evaluator?
Say you build an e-commerce system, which computes the shipping cost for the items that the user put into his/her shopping cart. Because you don't know the merchant's shipping cost model at implementation time, you could implement a set of shipping cost models that come to mind (flat charge, by weight, by number of items, ...) and select one of those at run-time.
In practice, you will most certainly find that the shipping cost models you implemented will rarely match what the merchant wants, so you must add custom models, which are merchant-specific. If the merchant's model changes later, you must change your code, re-compile and re-distribute your software.
Because this is so unflexible, the shipping cost expression should be specified at run-time, not at compile-time. This implies that the expression must be scanned, parsed and evaluated at run-time, which is why you need an expression evaluator.
A simple expression evaluator would parse an expression and create a "syntax tree". The expression "a + b * c", for example, would compile into a "Sum" object who's first operand is parameter "a" and who's second operand is a "Product" object who's operands are parameters "b" and "c". Such a syntax tree can evaluated relatively quickly. However, the run-time performance is about a factor of 100 worse than that of native Java code.

German.Keywords: Java Compiler klein schnell Embedded Ausdruck Ausdrücke auswerten Script Scripte JVM Virtual machine Bytecode Laufzeit-Übersetzung JSP Server Pages
German.Char_Desc_80: Eine super-kleiner, super-schneller Java-Compiler, der Ausdrücke und Scripte zur Laufzeit übersetzt.
German.Char_Desc_250: Ein super-kleiner, super-schneller Compiler, der einen Java-Ausdruck, -Block oder eine -Quelldatei liest und Java-Bytecode generiert, der direkt geladen und ausgeführt wird. Er ist nicht als Entwicklungswerkzeug gedacht sondern als "embedded"-Compiler für Laufzeitanwendungen.
German.Char_Desc_450: Janino ist ein super-kleiner, super-schneller Compiler, der einen Java-Ausdruck, einen Java-Block oder eine Java-Quelldatei liest und Java-Bytecode generiert, der direkt geladen und ausgeführt wird. Er ist nicht als Entwicklungswerkzeug gedacht sondern als "embedded"-Compiler für Laufzeitanwendungen wie die Auswertung von Ausdrücken oder "Server Pages"-Engines wie JSP.
German.Char_Desc_2000: Janino ist ein super-kleiner, super-schneller Compiler, der einen Java-Ausdruck, einen Java-Block oder eine Java-Quelldatei liest und Java-Bytecode generiert, der direkt geladen und ausgeführt wird. Er ist nicht als Entwicklungswerkzeug gedacht sondern als "embedded"-Compiler für Laufzeitanwendungen wie die Auswertung von Ausdrücken oder "Server Pages"-Engines wie JSP.
